Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: Delete an entry from property file: :How to delete key and value from property file? My property file has these contents:key1=value1 key2=value2I used the below code to delete the entry key2=value2. After that, now the file has these values:key1=value1 key2=value2Wed Mar 06 12:36:32 IST 2013 key1=value1java code to remove an entry:FileOutputStream out1 = new FileOutputStream(file, true);prop.remove(key);prop.store(out1,null);What is the mistake am doing. How to clear the whole content of the file before writing it.
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer: <<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.*;
import java.util.Properties;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        File file = new File("file.properties");
        Properties prop = new Properties();
        prop.load(new FileInputStream(file));
        prop.remove("key2");
        PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(file);
        prop.store(writer, null);
        writer.close();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The code reads the property file, removes the key "key2" and then writes the updated properties back to the file. The PrintWriter.write method is used to clear the whole content of the file before writing it.
```java
PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(file);
```
This line of code creates a new PrintWriter object that writes to the specified file. By calling the write method on this object, we can clear the content of the file.
```java
prop.store(writer, null);
```
This line of code stores the updated properties back to the file. The null argument is used as the comment to be written at the top of the file.
```java
writer.close();
```
This line of code closes the PrintWriter, which also flushes the output to the file.
```
Please note that the PrintWriter.write method does not clear the content of the file. It writes the specified string to the file. If you want to clear the content of the file, you should use the PrintWriter.print or PrintWriter.println methods instead.

Also, ensure that the file you are trying to delete the key from is a property file and that the key you are trying to delete exists in the file. If the key does not exist, the remove method will not throw an exception, but the properties file will remain unchanged.

Lastly, always make sure to handle exceptions that may occur when working with files and I/O operations. In this case, the IOException is thrown when the file does not exist or cannot be opened.
